attributes.action: We do not want a Norwegian EEC paid membership trade deal, or a Swiss deal.
attributes.background:
In the recent EU in/out referendum, the majority of the UK voted to leave the european union and we do not want a Norwegian or Swiss deal which would defeat the leave vote and why we voted leave.
We do not want to be a paid member of the EEC single market trading zone.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Conservative ministers have been reported by the BBC, Boris Johnson in particular of desiring a Norwegian trade zone membership deal against the interests of Britain and the majority of British voters who voted to leave europe and the single market.

Staying in the single market will do the economic damage David Cameron was talking about, and it will prevent us taking back control of our borders, immigration, fishing limits and full law making powers therefore it is against public interest.

attributes.action: Honour our Queen by minting coins in real silver
attributes.background: Being a metal detectorist my friends and I find so many beautiful ancient coins that have stood up to being buried for centuries.  The coins we have now would have all rotted away of a similar period, let's honour our Queen by minting a few nice silver coins.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at the Spinks coin book and you can see many examples of the beautiful coins our Monarchy once had minted in their name. For me to give examples I would need to be able to upload examples of Silver Hammered coins or the Silver Milled ones of more recent times.

attributes.action: Teach anti-racist/bullying and self esteem building classes in schools
attributes.background: In this day and age we have come across more prejudice, xenophobia, racism and bullying.  This has escalated due to recent events.  In order for the future generation of children the most important thing a child should learn is respect for self and others.
attributes.additional_details: We must teach that bullying is wrong, tolerance for others is important for the process of peace. The current situation as we have discovered from recent events from voting out, has left our country in a state of racism, xenophobia and bullying.  We must act quickly to instigate peace and so that the new generation of Brits are tolerance, happier and peaceful people.  We have a country of British people of all races, religions, sexes and we must learn to live in peace and respectful of each other.  Bullying has been a major factor in all schools and the only way to diminish it is to build respect for self and others through classes and build their self esteem. This will have a positive impact for the future generation of British people no matter what race they are from.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to display a halal food sign in businesses serving halal food.
attributes.background: All businesses serving halal food should clearly display a sign at the entrance of their establishment stating that the food they serve is halal. This would allow people of the Muslim faith to clearly identify where they are permitted to eat and Sikhs to identify where they cannot eat.

attributes.action: Establish London as an independent state so it can remain in the EU
attributes.background: Greater London voted overwhelmingly to remain. A disproportionate amount of our taxes goes to finance other regions in the UK & our economic wellbeing is severely threatened by a decision imposed upon us by others. We wish to cede from the UK & become an independent state within the EU.

attributes.action: Give all British expats and EU citizens living long-term in UK vote on EU.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Act of 2015 disqualified many people who vote in local or general elections from voting on EU membership. We ask for a reform of the Act, to give franchise on EU membership to all British expats, and to EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years.
attributes.additional_details:
Commonwealth citizens residing in the UK could vote on EU membership on 23rd June 2016, whilst expats living abroad for more than fifteen years, and EU citizens living in Britain, could not. This disfavours individuals who have fully invested in the opportunities granted by Britain’s long-term membership of the EU. We believe the Act goes against EU rights of free movement and the constitutional, common law of Britain.
We ask for another Act to be passed to allow a new Referendum in which all expats, and EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years, may vote. If we are to leave or remain in the EU, it must be a lawful decision, reflecting the wishes of our entire society.

attributes.action: Ban smoking on footpaths, walkways and public places
attributes.background: Passive smoking is becoming a serious health issue, specifically in urban area. Every morning, thousands of non-smokers have to face passive smoking while going to work as other people smoke on footpaths and walkways. A large number of people do not use designated smoking zones.
attributes.additional_details:
A quick look at this article from Cancer Research UK will tell us how dangerous passive smoking can be - http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking

Unwanted passive smoking on the streets of major UK cities is causing health issues that are not very easy to detect in early stages. Overall, passive smoking is affecting the health of non-smokers living or working in urban areas in a significant way.

attributes.action: Reform section 127, Communications Act & Section 1, Malicious Communications Act
attributes.background:
Signatories of this petition ask the Government to remove any reference of the following from section 127, Communications Act & Section 1, Malicious Communications Act

“Grossly offensive” , “Indecent”, “obscene” , “Causing annoyance”, “inconvenience”,  and “needless anxiety”.
attributes.additional_details:
A number of cases have made it to the national press of people being arrested for “Grossly offensive” jokes and comments on twitter and FB. Section 127 and Section 1 both have wording that is extremely vague and ambiguous. Both acts can be read here:

http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/21/section/127
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1988/27/section/1

Free expression is the corner stone of a free democracy. Reform these laws to remove ambiguity and respect that vital human right.

attributes.action: Taking TATA Steel pensioners money by changes to the law is immoral & wrong !!!
attributes.background:
All Pensioners not just TATA Steel pensioners are one of the lowest income areas in our society and to contemplate retrospective law changes after pensioners have signed a legally binding document is wrong and will undoubtably open the floodgates for ALL other businesses to follow.

STOP THIS NOW!
attributes.additional_details:
I strongly DO NOT support cutting pensioners money retrospectively.

If the Government changes the rules, there is nothing to stop ALL businesses doing the same should they find their pensions fund has a deficit.

What happens 3 or 5 or maybe 10 years down the line when the TATA Steel Works is in trouble again. Will the Government change the rules again to take EVEN more money off pensioners?

Its hard enough for Pensioners to live now .....
STOP THIS NOW BEFORE ITS YOUR TURN NEXT !!!

attributes.action: Make the UK main summer test cricket series, a free to air television event.
attributes.background: This petition is for a ruling, that the main test cricket series of the summer in England or Wales be shown on free to air television. As are The FA Cup, The Six Nations and The Grand National; with a protected, permanent free to air broadcasting status.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition strongly believes that in order to develop the next generation of cricket stars, youngsters need to be able to easily and readily see cricketing heroes, performing at the highest cricket level. It is one of our national sports and the entire nation should be able to watch the main summer test match series.

This is one test series a year on free to air television. So this petition feels that this is a fair demand.

attributes.action: Remove hereditary peers from the House of Lords
attributes.background: The time has come to remove an outdated oddity from Parliament. There is no place for peers who gain their positions simply by being born into them. This is the logical step needed to finish the reforms of 1999.

attributes.action: Don't make student nurses pay for their tuition
attributes.background: The country is built on its NHS and making nurses pay for their tuition will surely spell the end for this great service and stop thousands from taking up nursing. We need them and the NHS

attributes.action: The PM to report monthly on progress and initiatives to tackle tax avoidance
attributes.background: We increasingly hear about tax avoidance by the rich and by large companies. We also hear politicians say that they are keen to see this issue tackled but warm words aren't enough, let's see a monthly report, including quantifiable measures, so we can see and track progress in a systematic way
attributes.additional_details: Tax avoidance in the UK reputedly costs the UK £16 billion a year. It is not fair and it should be tackled rigorously by the Government and the Prime Minister should be held to account personally

attributes.action: Ban domesticated cats from being allowed to roam freely outdoors
attributes.background:
In 2014 there were estimated to be 8 million cats in Britain
It isn't natural for there to be 8 million cats roaming around this land. 
Cats kill 55 million birds a year, millions of other animals too, spread fleas, deficate on other peoples property and get ran over and cause accidents.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.pfma.org.uk/pet-population-2014
http://www.rspb.org.uk/makeahomeforwildlife/advice/gardening/unwantedvisitors/cats/birddeclines.aspx
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-19353/Cats-kill-275-million-animals-year.html

attributes.action: Ban the use of retractable dog leads exept on beaches or fields away from roads.
attributes.background: There isn't a day goes by where I almost wrap a dog around the wheels of my car because the owner fails to retracts the lead enough to stop the dog wandering into the road. I'm a dog owner, I love animals, walk them on a retractable lead by all means, but do it away from traffic and risk of death.
attributes.additional_details: Some people may be unable to let their dog off lead, and want to give the feeling of freedom to their believed animal, this is understandable. However it's not only death or seriously injury to the dog which is at stake, a car swerving and avoiding the dog could cause harm to pedestrians and other road users, this has happened to me many times but luckily I've avoided any harm.  I know someone who's dog was killed when his wife used a retractable lead on a residential street, it's avoidable.

attributes.action: Require eCommerce and mail order companies to disclose their chosen courier.
attributes.background:
Currently the courier used is seen as a service offered to the seller however really it is just as much a service for the buyer.
Because the buyer has know knowledge of what courier will be used they are unable to avoid companies that have provided them with poor service in the past.
attributes.additional_details:
This results in a non-functioning market where prices are driven to low level by consumer demand for free delivery but there is no balance where demand for the services reduce due to poor service.
The simple market solution to this problem is to allow consumers to vote with their wallet by giving them the choice to not use couriers who provide them with a poor service.

attributes.action: Ban loud vehicle exhaust modification
attributes.background: Ban people modifying their cars and bikes to have louder exhausts than the ones they come with. There is no reason what so ever for these people to have loud exhausts apart from misguided vanity, yet the general public have to put up with their right to peace and quiet being removed by a few idiots.
attributes.additional_details: I live and work in central Elgin and have to listen to the same cars tearing round and round the town centre over and over again day and night. Ban this pointless modification culture now, as I'm sure it will only get worse. It is unfair and there is no need for them to be doing this. It is anti-social behaviour and a nuisance.

attributes.action: Introduce Environmental Studies into the National school curriculum
attributes.background: With one of the hottest Winters on record it is ever more clear that our climate is changing, Affecting the environment. What can we do to prevent it? We must educate future generations on how to sustain a clean environment and the importance of energy conservation, consumption and waste management.
attributes.additional_details:
Data collected by NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration showed that the global average temperature was 0.13C warmer than 2014. Meanwhile the UK's Met Office confirmed that 2015 was 0.75C warmer than the long-term average from 1961 to 1990. 

 In 2015, warming reached 1C above pre-Industrial levels for the first time. It's clear that the time we have left to prevent warming from reaching above 2C over pre-Industrial levels is ticking away.

Act before it is too late.

attributes.action: The government should implement a road tax on all adult cyclists. £40 per year
attributes.background: Cyclists use the road as much as car drivers do. In many cases cyclist show a marked lack of road sense and manners. They block many country roads so it is is only fair that they pay to use the roads. Displaying a valid road tax would reduce accidents and allow easy tracking of offenders

attributes.action: Have the part of the TV licence fee that goes to the BBC scrapped.
attributes.background: I feel it is wrong to be forced to fund an organisation that is complicit in the covering up of child abuse.

attributes.action: Amend Consumer Protection Act 1987 to include advice given by consumer experts
attributes.background: Advice given by travel consumer experts in the media is always minimal. So much information is omitted that if anyone follows the advice they may suffer financial losses. The CPA 1987 should be amended to force these experts to explain what risks are involved in following their suggestions.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g. - Ravi Rajani on ITV's Lorraine (11/8/16) 
He did not warn of the financial risk when booking travel separately. This is irresponsible coming so soon after the collapse of a holiday company with inadequate financial cover. A consumer champion should advise that the protection offered by the Package Travel, Package Holidays and Package Tours Regulations 1992 and Atol is far more important than saving pennies on the booking.

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from UK driving licenses and V5 documents as soon as possible
attributes.background: The UK is now in the process of leaving the EU. It is therefore unnecessary and wrong to have important UK legal documents displaying the EU flag. Along with having a blue UK passport; UK driving licenses and V5 documents should display the Union Jack instead of the EU flag.

attributes.action: Stop charging NHS staff for parking fees
attributes.background:
Payments are now been increased yearly.  Not adequate parking spaces hence time wasted in mornings looking for spaces.

Other businesses have free parking facilities.

Nursing should not pay to park when saving lives.

attributes.action: The law protecting seagulls in the UK needs to be changed or suspended.
attributes.background: In recent years, the population of seagulls has increased to the point where they are more than just a nuisance. Adults and children have been attacked as these scavengers have become the rats by the sea. Food is not safe anywhere outdoors and this is affecting local businesses and residents.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to be changed or suspended so that people can protect themselves and their property, and the Government must also consider a humane cull of some sort.

attributes.action: Please start funding pet cemeteries like other country's.
attributes.background: I think we can all agree that our pets are more than just pets, they become best friends and family members. it is only because of my dog that I can leave my house due to my mental health. He is my bet friend and I think others will agree we need a place to rest them just like we do with people.
attributes.additional_details: As a lot of us see them as more than pets, we should have places where we can bury them and let them rest in piece. They are loved ones and should be treated as such. They don't ask for a lot in life, all they ask for is love and care and don't we all just want love? If you look after your animal, they will look after you. Please consider this as I can assure you, many, many people will really appreciate being able to use these places. Thank you.

attributes.action: Shouting Racist when it is not to be charged for ''Incitement to racial hatred"
attributes.background: People who shout RACIST and point the finger when it is not are causing major hate and divisions in the UK and should be imprisoned for ''Incitement to racial hatred"
attributes.additional_details:
Everyday online and in the media we hear of RACISM when it is not. We see Labour Councillors and MPs crying Racist when people are just trying to express how they feel.

This shouting of Racism takes the light off real Racist and Racism and the people of the UK are now starting to forget real racist attacks as they are ''FED UP'' with being branded a racist when they are not.

attributes.action: Legally require force food suppliers to label all halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.background:
I am not Muslim, i do not wish to eat halal meat, l do not agree with it religiously & ethically, i support animal rights.
I have accidentally eaten halal meat and this caused me religious and ethical issues and has deeply offended me, i demand ALL shops clearly label halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco- "we do not specify to suppliers whether halal practices should be followed"
M&S-  "we do not specify any religious practice as part of our sourcing policy so therefore do not label"

Sainsburys- "in NZ it is common for lamb to be blessed"

Morrisons- "all our lamb from NZ is pre-stunned and blessed"

Co-Op- "there is currently no UK wide labelling scheme"

ASDA- "No comment"

Waitrose- " there is currently no UK labelly scheme and we believe this is a matter where government should lead "

attributes.action: Legalise civil partnerships for heterosexual couples
attributes.background: Everyone, whether heterosexual, homosexual, or bisexual, should have the option of entering into either a marriage, or a civil partnership.

attributes.action: Improve access to NHS dental services in Cornwall and Devon
attributes.background: According to Cornwall's NHS Dental Helpline, there is a six- to 12-month wait just to get on an NHS dentist's books in Cornwall. In late 2015 there were 7,500 people on the waiting list. We desperately need better access to NHS treatment as few people can afford private dental fees.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.piratefm.co.uk/news/latest-news/1834169/7500-wait-for-a-dentist-in-cornwall/

attributes.action: Mandate our EU representatives veto further EU expansion instead of Brexit
attributes.background: Much of the leave campaign support seemed to surround the potential for Turkey and other countries joining the EU. Rather than leaving the EU, we should mandate that we use our power of veto to ensure that this does not happen.
attributes.additional_details: I have watched countless TV programmes interviewing the supporters and voters of the leave  campaign. This appears to be the main issue, with many saying that the migrants that are here should be allowed to stay. By mandating our power of veto, this would facilitate the UK staying in the EU, with the benefits it brings and stop the EU from expanding by increasing the member countries.

attributes.action: Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service check
attributes.background:
It is not compulsory for Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check. Previously known as a CRB check.

From the age of 16 you are eligible for Compulsive Basic Training (on a scooter) which means you can have 1:1 tuition from an approved Motorcycle Instructor.
attributes.additional_details:
A teaching profession which involves contact with young people should have DBS check as a mandatory requirement to safeguard the general public.  NHS workers, teachers and approved driving instructors (ADI) all have a DBS check.

The Driving Standards and Vehicles Agency uses the loose term of 'Fit and Proper' to approve a Motorcycle Instructor. Those individuals who have a previous criminal record, or spent time in prison, can still become or continue their role as Motorcycle Instructor.

attributes.action: Require 75% turnout 60% majority for & 16+ voting in future   referendums
attributes.background: Less than 40% of UK Adults voted to for Brexit- a change that can't be reversed.  We must introduce a "triple lock" on future referendums about constitutional and irreversible changes.  The turn out must exceed 75%,  the majority in favour of change must exceed 60% and all those aged 16+ can vote

attributes.action: Scrap charges at hospital car parks.
attributes.background: It is unfair and at times a dangerous practice to charge.  It is an essential service and causes problems for visiting routine and emergency appointments.  It causes unnecessary hardship.

attributes.action: That Non Stun slaughter be debated in Parliament.
attributes.background: I have researched what the doctrinal basis for Shechita is. We are in the new millennium and Shechita slaughter is no longer the most humane way to kill. When the Holy Prophet was alive, stunning methods used today did not exist.
attributes.additional_details:
The Food Research Institute state that killing an animal before it is bled out by high voltage electrical stunning does not affect the amount of blood lost from the carcass.  I have spoken to Jewish people on this issue they say they can see no reason why animals cannot be stunned first.
A witness to Shechita slaughter described a knife was drawn 17 times across a bullocks throat. A shock on his face as he tried to move away.

attributes.action: Ethical consumption rating to be displayed alongside price for all products
attributes.background:
Our current consumption culture focuses on price. The true cost of buying that product is rarely reflected in the price.

The introduction of an ethical consumption traffic light system at brand level will enable conscientious consumers to easily make informed decisions about what they buy.
attributes.additional_details:
An ethical rating should be founded on the following core principles:
 -Environmental impact
 -People (wages, working conditions, exploitation of employees)
 -Animals (animal testing, welfare of animals)
 -Political activity
 -Product Sustainability (Organic, Fairtrade, Positive Environmental Features)

attributes.action: Make 23 April "NHS appreciation day"
attributes.background: 1 and 17 March, and 30 November are bank holidays in Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland. There is no such holiday on 23 April in England. This date should be nominated as appreciation day of a Great British and Northern Irish institution to unite all who benefit from this service around the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS makes me proud to be a citizen of the UK. As I sit here and write this from my baby son's bedside on a children's ward, I am moved to tears by the care he is receiving tonight from highly trained and caring professionals who have left their own family behind to care for mine. What is most amazing is that this is free at the point of use for all. Why not dedicate a day per year for the appreciation of the NHS and its staff.

attributes.action: Remove VAT on investment silver coins and bars.
attributes.background:
Silver coins and bars are an accessible long term investment for many people. The application of VAT on silver is unfair. 

There is no VAT on investment gold coins and bars which favours wealthier investors. Some EU states do not charge VAT on silver bullion which gives them an unfair advantage.
attributes.additional_details:
Silver has been bought as a store of value for centuries. Most investments do not attract VAT for example stocks, shares, bonds, savings accounts, property and gold bullion.

1 Kilogram silver bars and 1oz silver Britannia coins are the most commonly purchased silver investments in the UK.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Abolishing the Welsh Assembly
attributes.background: A petition was created during the last coalition government (2010-15) which was not widely publicised and gained only 3 signatures. The Welsh Assembly elections are about to take place and the "Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party" are encouraging people to sign a petition to call for a 3rd. referendum.
attributes.additional_details: You will find all the supporting material in the Assembly Election pamphlets that are pouring onto our door steps. This gives you all the persuasion you need to support this petition.

attributes.action: Ban E-Cigarettes from indoor public areas and workplaces.
attributes.background: These devices are a nuisance, pollute the air, and are encouraging people to become addicted to nicotine. The advertising is showing these products as a trendy fashion accessory and "cool and sophisticated" to use. There are clear risks to people close by by passively inhaling the vapour.

attributes.action: The NHS MUST stop giving free treatment to immigrants immediately!
attributes.background: The UK is constantly taking in immigrants from other countries, however we CANNOT afford to pay for so much people for their treatment. At this rate, if the NHS does continue to pay for their treatment, the NHS will start to collapse. We must only give free treatment to our British citizens.
attributes.additional_details: If we continue to provide free health care to Non British people (and there is loads of them) then we will come to the point where we cannot even help ourselves. Lets get this to 100,000 signatures, so MPs can debate a such important issue. The government seriously needs to stop it, we CANNOT afford it.

attributes.action: Give the NHS a percentage of tuition fees from all HE health careers courses.
attributes.background: The NHS would benefit from extra funding. They should be given a percentage of tuition fees from all health careers courses. Students studying these courses should oblige as the NHS is the future for the majority of their career. The extra funds would help with the upkeep and development of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is suffering from a lack of funding and a lack of staff. If they were to recieve a percentage of student tuition fees (only from health related courses) then there would be a boost in funding. It could also be an incentive to encourage more people to study these courses and eventually work for the NHS, as they would feel as though there University costs have contributed to their future career on another level.

attributes.action: Incentivise broadband providers, only pay for the broad band you get
attributes.background: Provider use the phrase ‘up to’ so there is no incentive for them to improve the speed or systems to provide what you are paying for.  e.g  speed quoted at 20 Mbs and you get 10 Mbs then you would only pay half the cost and so on. Providers would then need to tell the truth on broad band speeds.

attributes.action: Revise the Honours system.
attributes.background: A cross-party body be set up to radically review the UK Honours system and replace it with one that works according to widely supported criteria and does not reward people for their political allegiances.
attributes.additional_details: Transparent and publicly supported criteria for awarding honours are required which reward people for services to community, the economy, country, mankind and the natural world, but not solely for political allegiance.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation of Lancaster Post Office
attributes.background: Lancaster Post Office has become a historic local institution providing a wide range of services. Relocating it could reduce the service offered to customers in the long run, make access difficult for the disabled and the elderly and would be unsuitable for people who don't like crowded spaces.
attributes.additional_details: The current post office is spacious which enables it to offer a wide range of services, it is on the ground floor, very close to town centre, is a couple of minutes walk from a large car park on Dallas Road and is next door to the local Royal Mail Delivery Office. W.H Smiths would offer non of these advantages except the fact it is in town centre because there is no nearby parking and having postal vans would have to go through a pedestrianised area.

attributes.action: Change in Immigration rules due to the immigration solicitors negligence
attributes.background: Our application  for leave to remain was simply rejected because our Immigration solicitor showed negligence in our application, after spending 11 years in UK we are now on verge to be removed from UK, I request everyone to sign this petition and bring change in immigration rules
attributes.additional_details:
We want Secretary of State to consider Solicitor's negligence as an exceptional circumstances.

For Example Law includes below as exceptional circumstances currently :
o travel or postal delays. 
or beyond control situation for applicant.
For example:
o The Home Office has lost or delayed returning travel documents.
o The applicant is having problems replacing lost documents as a result of theft, fire or
flood. 

but Point requested to be included in Law is as below:
o Your previous solicitor's showed negligence in your case and you have evidance from legal ombudsman to prove solicitors negligence.

attributes.action: PM table economic review & articulate parameters Brexit not in National Interest
attributes.background:
For strong leadership in this time of uncertainty, UK citizens demand Prime Minister to immediately table an economic review of unintended consequences of vote to leave EU

It is in national interest for PM to articulate economic parameters of unemployment & growth where Brexit will not be Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
Mark Carney Governor Bank of England has articulated likelihood of lower economic growth due to Brexit

Forecast group EY Item Club says business investment & consumer spending will be held back because of uncertainty

Low-cost travel group has gone into administration as direct result of Brexit. How many more organisations will be impacted directly by Brexit cost of jobs & growth?

Lower future economic growth will impact government tax revenues & therefore forecasts of government debt

attributes.action: Close all faith schools immediately and make a more harmoneous population !.
attributes.background: Our children are the future but in this world of uncertainty and hurt we seem to encourage it by allowing faith schools to propagate . This is wrong and now more than ever ! we need to make certain that our children's future is secure and free from hate and prejudice...
attributes.additional_details: I was educated in a catholic school .... But my mum was a catholic and my dad was a prodestant and neither cared about religion !! Which is how it should be .....I realised early on that we are all the same and at this early age we have the chance to guarantee the same future for our children and our children's children ....but we need to mix all the kids together and let them experience thus for themselves and we need to do it now !!....not tomorrow or the next day but now ...today

attributes.action: Set up Brexit commission to advise on implications before Article 50 invoked
attributes.background: In the referendum campaign voters asked for the facts but with no historic precedent this left politicians free to say anything to secure votes.  The implications are now much clearer with some known facts to draw on. An independent commission will provide impartial advice before invoking Article 50

attributes.action: Empty black bins once a week in summer and hot spells.
attributes.background: I, like many others suffer during the summer and sometimes other seasons  with fly and maggots in my black bin, even though I have it cleaned after every empty. I think the government should force councils to empty the black bins once a week during hot spells to reduce this.

attributes.action: Don't rush Brexit: invoke Article 50 after the next general election in 2020.
attributes.background:
The government carried out it's promise to have a referendum; it was not elected to exit the European Union. 

Exiting the European Union is a massive undertaking, and requires planning, strong leadership and clear vision.

For the Brexit to succeed, we need a government elected for the purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Points to consider from the Conservative Manifesto:
"Our commitment to you:
keep our economy secure by running a surplus so that we start paying down our debts."
"We will use our membership of ...the
EU [amongst other organisations]...to achieve the best for Britain."
"We want an EU that helps Britain move ahead..."
"The Conservative Party is the party of the Union
– and we will always do our utmost to keep our family
of nations together."
